clusters.title: Netanyahu rejects Western nations' recognition of Palestine
clusters.neutral_headline: Western Nations Recognize Palestine, Israel Reacts Negatively

items.title: Netanyahu rejects Western nations' recognition of Palestine
items.standfirst: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that a Palestinian state “will not happen,” responding to moves by several Western nations. Australia, Canada, and the UK recognized Palestinian statehood over the weekend, with France expected to follow suit Monday ahead of the UN General Assembly in…
items.content: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu said that a Palestinian state “will not happen,” responding to moves by several Western nations. Australia, Canada, and the UK recognized Palestinian statehood over the weekend, with France expected to follow suit Monday ahead of the UN General Assembly in…

items.title: France to recognise Palestinian state but Germany and Italy say not yet
items.standfirst: President Emmanuel Macron, backed by several other European countries, described France's move as a "necessity".
items.content: President Emmanuel Macron, backed by several other European countries, described France's move as a "necessity".

items.title: French towns fly Palestinian flag despite government orders ahead of state recognition
items.standfirst: Some French mayors have defied government orders and flown Palestinian flags on town halls, with more expected to follow suit as France prepares to formally recognize a Palestinian state at the United Nations General Assembly. FRANCE 24's Antonia Kerrigan has more on from Saint Denis, nearby Paris.
items.content: Some French mayors have defied government orders and flown Palestinian flags on town halls, with more expected to follow suit as France prepares to formally recognize a Palestinian state at the United Nations General Assembly. FRANCE 24's Antonia Kerrigan has more on from Saint Denis, nearby Paris.

items.title: French town halls raise the Palestinian flag in defiance of interior ministry order
items.standfirst: Ahead of President Emmanuel Macron’s expected recognition of the state of Palestine at the UN on Monday, almost two dozen French town halls raised the Palestinian flag above their entrances despite the interior ministry's warning not to do so. "The principle of neutrality in public service prohibits such displays," the interior ministry said.
items.content: Ahead of President Emmanuel Macron’s expected recognition of the state of Palestine at the UN on Monday, almost two dozen French town halls raised the Palestinian flag above their entrances despite the interior ministry's warning not to do so. "The principle of neutrality in public service prohibits such displays," the interior ministry said.

items.title: What does recognising a Palestinian state mean?
items.standfirst: The UK, Australia and Canada have recognised a Palestinian state, while France and other countries are set to do so in the coming days.
items.content: The UK, Australia and Canada have recognised a Palestinian state, while France and other countries are set to do so in the coming days.

items.title: Israeli ministers call for West Bank annexation after recognition push
items.standfirst: UK and three other countries formally recognised Palestine on Sunday
items.content: UK and three other countries formally recognised Palestine on Sunday

items.title: Western powers recognise Palestinian state, drawing Israeli fury
items.standfirst: Britain, Australia, Canada and Portugal recognised Palestine on Sunday, a historic shift in Western policy that angered Israel. Palestinians in Gaza hailed it as a victory, while Netanyahu vowed a Palestinian state would never exist. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky has more from Jerusalem.
items.content: Britain, Australia, Canada and Portugal recognised Palestine on Sunday, a historic shift in Western policy that angered Israel. Palestinians in Gaza hailed it as a victory, while Netanyahu vowed a Palestinian state would never exist. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky has more from Jerusalem.

items.title: Israel-Palestine two-state solution summit to be held as recognitions surge
items.standfirst: Israel and the US are boycotting the UN-hosted event, but other countries are building on an earlier declaration.
items.content: Israel and the US are boycotting the UN-hosted event, but other countries are building on an earlier declaration.

items.title: Israel continuing assault on Gaza after U.K. and others recognize Palestinian statehood
items.standfirst: The United Kingdom, Canada and Australia officially recognized Palestine as a state Sunday, a move that has long been opposed by the U.S. and Israel. More countries are expected to do the same this week as world leaders gather in New York for the U.N. General Assembly. Seth Doane in Tel Aviv has more.
items.content: The United Kingdom, Canada and Australia officially recognized Palestine as a state Sunday, a move that has long been opposed by the U.S. and Israel. More countries are expected to do the same this week as world leaders gather in New York for the U.N. General Assembly. Seth Doane in Tel Aviv has more.

items.title: UK to push peace plan at UN summit after recognising Palestinian state - but Netanyahu says Palestine 'will not happen'
items.standfirst: The UK is set to push for a peace plan for the Middle East at the UN General Assembly after recognising the state of Palestine.
items.content: The UK is set to push for a peace plan for the Middle East at the UN General Assembly after recognising the state of Palestine.

items.title: UK recognises state of Palestine to ‘keep alive’ the possibility of peace
items.standfirst: Keir Starmer says announcement shows government’s hopes for a secure Israel alongside a viable PalestineNetanyahu says recognition is a prize for terrorismThe UK has formally recognised Palestine as an independent state, Keir Starmer has said, in a deeply symbolic announcement which the government hopes will show its commitment to peace in the region and ease domestic political tensions.In a sign of the global concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, Canada and Australia also made their own formal declarations recognising Palestine on Sunday ahead of a conference of the UN general assembly in New York. Continue reading...
items.content: Keir Starmer says announcement shows government’s hopes for a secure Israel alongside a viable PalestineNetanyahu says recognition is a prize for terrorismThe UK has formally recognised Palestine as an independent state, Keir Starmer has said, in a deeply symbolic announcement which the government hopes will show its commitment to peace in the region and ease domestic political tensions.In a sign of the global concern over the humanitarian crisis in Gaza, Canada and Australia also made their own formal declarations recognising Palestine on Sunday ahead of a conference of the UN general assembly in New York. Continue reading...

items.title: How will recognition of Palestinian statehood be greeted in the UK?
items.standfirst: As well as being deeply symbolic, the move is also a major foreign policy shift for the Labour governmentThe UK’s formal recognition of Palestinian statehood is deeply symbolic on the world stage, but the major foreign policy shift is also a significant political step for the Labour government at home. The announcement followed mounting pressure on Keir Starmer from within the Labour party and beyond. Continue reading...
items.content: As well as being deeply symbolic, the move is also a major foreign policy shift for the Labour governmentThe UK’s formal recognition of Palestinian statehood is deeply symbolic on the world stage, but the major foreign policy shift is also a significant political step for the Labour government at home. The announcement followed mounting pressure on Keir Starmer from within the Labour party and beyond. Continue reading...

items.title: U.K. formally recognizes Palestinian state
items.standfirst: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the U.K. will recognize a Palestinian state after Israel failed to agree to a ceasefire in Gaza. Australia and Canada have made similar announcements ahead of the United Nations General Assembly.
items.content: British Prime Minister Keir Starmer announced the U.K. will recognize a Palestinian state after Israel failed to agree to a ceasefire in Gaza. Australia and Canada have made similar announcements ahead of the United Nations General Assembly.

items.title: Watch: Keir Starmer says UK recognises Palestinian state
items.standfirst: Prime Minister Starmer says the move will "revive the hope of peace" but Israel says it is "nothing but a reward for jihadist Hamas".
items.content: Prime Minister Starmer says the move will "revive the hope of peace" but Israel says it is "nothing but a reward for jihadist Hamas".

items.title: Why is the UK Recognising a Palestinian State Now?
items.standfirst: Starmer said in July the UK would shift position unless Israel met several conditions.
items.content: Starmer said in July the UK would shift position unless Israel met several conditions.

items.title: UK officially recognises Palestine as a state
items.standfirst: Sir Keir Starmer has announced the UK has officially recognised Palestine as a state.
items.content: Sir Keir Starmer has announced the UK has officially recognised Palestine as a state.

items.title: ‘MurdochTok’: Trump taps Fox Corp for role in new US TikTok ownership
items.standfirst: President Donald Trump name-dropped media mogul Rupert Murdoch and his heir Lachlan as key figures involved in efforts to take control of TikTok in the United States. items.title: ‘Kafkaesque’: teacher in Birmingham fights to clear his name after identity fraud
items.standfirst: Michael Bene is repaying £763 ‘advance’ despite evidence he did not attend face-to-face verification interviewA special needs teacher has spent almost a year trying to clear his name after a fraudulent universal credit claim was made using his identity, which has left him on the hook for hundreds of pounds in repayments.The Department for Work and Pensions (DWP) has refused to acknowledge the fraud, even though Michael Bene has supplied evidence he was in the Scottish Highlands when the claimant attended a face-to-face verification interview in Cheshire. Continue reading...

items.title: TikTok’s Algorithm to Be Secured by Oracle in Trump-Backed Deal
TikTok’s Algorithm to Be Secured by Oracle in Trump-Backed Deal
items.standfirst: Oracle Corp. would recreate and provide security for a new US version of TikTok’s algorithm under a deal taking shape to sell the popular Chinese-owned app to a consortium of American investors, a White House official said, addressing a key concern raised by lawmakers in Washington.

clusters.title: Israeli-Palestinian conflict: How the push for a two-state solution could backfire
clusters.neutral_headline: International leaders discuss Palestinian state recognition

items.title: Israeli-Palestinian conflict: How the push for a two-state solution could backfire
items.standfirst: France and Saudi Arabia on Monday are set to join a raft of nations in officially recognising the state of Palestine amid a renewed push for a two-state solution. But some analysts warn the effort could backfire, entrenching unequal rights for Palestinians living under Israeli control and possibly prompting Israel to annex parts of the West Bank.
items.content: France and Saudi Arabia on Monday are set to join a raft of nations in officially recognising the state of Palestine amid a renewed push for a two-state solution. But some analysts warn the effort could backfire, entrenching unequal rights for Palestinians living under Israeli control and possibly prompting Israel to annex parts of the West Bank.

items.title: Live: France, several countries ready to recognise Palestinian state at UN

Follow our liveblog for the latest developments.

items.title: China prepares to evacuate 400,000 as super typhoon makes landfall in Philippines
items.standfirst: The Chinese city of Shenzhen began preparing to evacuate 400,000 people while residents of the northern Philippines sought shelter from gale-force winds Monday as Super Typhoon Ragasa continued on a collision course with southern China.
items.content: The Chinese city of Shenzhen began preparing to evacuate 400,000 people while residents of the northern Philippines sought shelter from gale-force winds Monday as Super Typhoon Ragasa continued on a collision course with southern China.

clusters.title: President al-Sharaa is first Syrian leader to visit UNGA in six decades
clusters.neutral_headline: Syrian President visits UN General Assembly after decades

items.title: President al-Sharaa is first Syrian leader to visit UNGA in six decades
items.standfirst: The last Syrian president to address the UN General Assembly spoke at the gathering in 1967.
items.content: The last Syrian president to address the UN General Assembly spoke at the gathering in 1967.

items.title: Al-Sharaa arrives in New York for first UN visit by a Syrian president in nearly six decades
items.standfirst: Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa arrived in New York on Sunday to attend the UN General Assembly, the first Syrian head of state to do so in nearly six decades. The last time a Syrian president addressed the gathering was in 1967, underscoring the visit’s historic nature.
items.content: Syrian President Ahmad al-Sharaa arrived in New York on Sunday to attend the UN General Assembly, the first Syrian head of state to do so in nearly six decades. The last time a Syrian president addressed the gathering was in 1967, underscoring the visit’s historic nature.

The last Syrian president to address the UNGA was in 1967.
The visit underscores the historic nature of the event.
Al-Sharaa is attending the UN General Assembly.
